item.title: bryan add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Eventually all things fall into place. Until then, laugh at the confusion, live for the moments, and know EVERYTHING HAPPENS FOR A REASON." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: bryan add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "No one can give a definition of the soul. But we know what it feels like. The soul is the sense of something higher than ourselves, something that stirs in us thoughts, hopes, and aspirations which go out to the world of goodness, truth and beauty. The soul is a burning desire to breathe in this world of light and never to lose it--to remain children of light." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: bryan add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "I don't know what your destiny will be, but one thing I know: the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who have sought and found how to serve." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: bryan add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "At times our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lighted the flame within us." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: bryan add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "There's a divinity that shapes our ends, Rough-hew them how we will." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: bryan add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: bryan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: bryan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: bryan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"Seven Deadly Sins
Wealth without work Pleasure without conscience Science without humanity Knowledge without character Politics without principle Commerce without morality Worship without sacrifice." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: bryan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: bryan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Prayer is not asking. It is a longing of the soul. It is daily admission of one's weakness. It is better in prayer to have a heart without words than words without a heart." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: bryan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: bryan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "To believe in something, and not to live it, is dishonest." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: bryan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: bryan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "To believe that what has not occurred in history will not occur at all, is to argue disbelief in the dignity of man." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: bryan add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "So live as if you were living already for the second time and as if you had acted the first time as wrongly as you are about to act now!" -- Viktor E. Frankl
